sim_wrapper module¶

sim_wrapper.parse_file(path)[source]¶

Super simple utility to parse a yaml file given a path

sim_wrapper.make_confs(global_conf)[source]¶

Make all the configuration dicts for each parameter combination

sim_wrapper.run_sim(conf)[source]¶

Actually runs simulation in a given directory. Expects a tuple containing the absolute path to the job directory as the first element and the configuration object for the job as the second element.

sim_wrapper.gc3_submit(gconf, sim_confs)[source]¶

This function runs jobs on a bunch of remote hosts via SSH and well as on the local machine using a library called gc3pie. Requires gc3pie to be installed and configured. Currently super slow and not really worth using.

sim_wrapper.execute_jobs(gconf, confs)[source]¶

Given a list of configuration dictionaries, run them either serially or in parallel by applying run_sim to each dict. We do this instead of applying to an actual Simulator object because the Simulator objects are not pickeable and thus cannot be parallelized by the multiprocessing lib

sim_wrapper.spectral_wrapper(opt_pars, baseconf)[source]¶

A wrapper function to handle spectral sweeps and postprocessing for the scipy minimizer. It accepts the initial guess as a vector, the base config file, and the keys that map to the initial guesses. It runs a spectral sweep (in parallel if specified), postprocesses the results, and returns the spectrally weighted reflection

sim_wrapper.run_optimization(conf)[source]¶

Runs an optimization on a given set of parameters

sim_wrapper.run(conf, log)[source]¶

The main run methods that decides what kind of simulation to run based on the provided config object

sim_wrapper.pre_check(conf_path, conf)[source]¶

Checks conf file for invalid values

sim_wrapper.main()[source]¶
